course.subject: IELM
course.name: Logistics and Freight Transportation Operations
course.description: Introduction to intermodalism, globalization, third-part logistics, carrier logistics, shipper logistics, manufacturing logistics, supply chain management, and rules, conventions and practices in various transportation modes. Discussion of characteristics, issues, and practices of air cargo systems, surface transportation systems, sea freight operations, and terminal operations.

reviews.author: 5M5
reviews.title: Logistics and Freight Transportation Operations
reviews.comment_content:
 Introduction of logistics and supply chain management, e.g., history and background
 Complexity of modern supply chains
 Basic economics concept: supply & demand, the concept of value and value creation, evolution of economy, international trade
 Air freight
 Sea freight
 Ground transport
 Forwarders, integrators, consolidation
 Miscellaneous topics.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. Lee teaches well. His English speaking is not very well but still acceptable. He always shared some personal experiences with us, which are interesting and sometimes inspiring.

I remember he said that it was the last time he taught this course.
reviews.comment_grading:
NO LAB !
Participation (5%)
Most of the time attendance was taken in the class that has guest speech. Students are asked to write down their names, id numbers and what they have learnt from the speaker and hand them in after class, but actually what you wrote down is not important.
Assignments (15%)
6 HWs in total. Similar to the examples in the lecture notes. However, it is not that easy to get full marks.
Midterm (35 %)
20%qualitative, 80%quantitative
Final Exam (45 %)
Accumulated. Similar to midterm.
reviews.comment_workload: Not too much workload, as long as you understand what is going on in each class.

reviews.author: pakning
reviews.title: Logistics and Freight Transportation Operations
reviews.comment_content:
-Introduction of logistics and supply chain management
-Complexity of modern supply chains
-supply & demand, the concept of value and value creation, evolution of economy, international trade
-Air freight
-Sea freight
-Ground transport
-Forwarders, integrators, consolidation
reviews.comment_teaching: She loves to interact with students, bonus point will be given to the students who are active in class. Don't be worry, the questions are simple as you can find it on the ppt slides. High mean scores in both midterm and final exam.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is pretty good
My result:
midterm: above one sd
final: above one sd
project: 16/20
bonus pt: 3.8/5
Final grade: A
